attributes.action: Provide legitimate reasons for enforcing lockdown restrictions in the UK
attributes.additional_details: As of 19 March 2020,COVID-19 has been no longer considered to be a high consequence infectious disease (HCID) in the UK,The Corona virus act which passed the House of Common without a vote on 23 March should be consider as legally VOID the lockdown declared on March 23rd, 2020 and it's future extensions should never be enforced.In accordance with NHIS&the UK corners reports,(FOI) there never was a pandemic emergency in the UK.The UK residents has never been asked to vote on the lockdown proposal
attributes.background: Asking the Governemnt and their system partners,Council officers and Councillors to provide legitimate reasons for enforcing lockdown restrictions in the United Kingdom and to refund and compensate UK residents on contracted services,paid for but limited or refused due to the lockdown restrictions

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about Covid-19 restrictions, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The Government has published a number of documents setting out the reasons for past and current restrictions, and these have also been discussed when relevant legislation has been discussed in the House of Commons.

If you want the Government to end current restrictions, you might like to sign the following petition:

Repeal Coronavirus Act and end all Covid-19 restrictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561995
